intro: Apterigia zangezurica, commonly known as the Zangezur bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous areas, preferring well-drained soils. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
